item.title: New training opportunity launched in national diving judge course
item.dc:creator: Linda Tjaguns
item.description:
Swim England is excited to launch a new training opportunity for volunteers and members which will see them progressing in their journey of becoming a diving judge. This course is aimed at any Swim England members who wish to gain an initial understanding of Diving FINA Rules and apply this within their club and regional […]

The post New training opportunity launched in national diving judge course appeared first on Swim England North East.
item.content:encoded:
Swim England is excited to launch a new training opportunity for volunteers and members which will see them progressing in their journey of becoming a diving judge.

This course is aimed at any Swim England members who wish to gain an initial understanding of Diving FINA Rules and apply this within their club and regional events organised by the region.

The course will be held virtually on Tuesday 6 April at 6.30 pm. It will enable participants to develop their knowledge of judging in diving and build on the basics they will have learned from completing the Introduction to Diving Judging resource which participants are encouraged to complete prior to attending.

Click here for further details.

The post New training opportunity launched in national diving judge course appeared first on Swim England North East.

item.title: North East Diving Nutrition Workshop – 10/4/21
item.dc:creator: Linda Tjaguns
item.description:
Time: 11.30-12.30pm Cost: £3.00 Number Restrictions: 100 Divers must be Category 1 or 2 Youth Sport Nutrition will be holding a virtual workshop on the fundamentals of nutrition for youth athletes in diving. The workshop will be taken by Emmy Campbell, Lead Nutritionist for Youth Sport Nutrition. This interactive session will cover all of the […]

The post North East Diving Nutrition Workshop – 10/4/21 appeared first on Swim England North East.
item.content:encoded:
Time: 11.30-12.30pm
Cost: £3.00
Number Restrictions: 100
Divers must be Category 1 or 2

Youth Sport Nutrition will be holding a virtual workshop on the fundamentals of nutrition for youth athletes in diving. The workshop will be taken by Emmy Campbell, Lead Nutritionist for Youth Sport Nutrition. This interactive session will cover all of the basics of nutrition for good health, as well as covering exactly what to eat and when to get the most out of your training days and take your diving to the next level. Younger athletes should be accompanied on this workshop by a parent/carer. Everyone who attends will receive a link after the workshop to book an optional free 15 minute individual diver and parent/carer consultation with Emmy.

Click here to book on

The post North East Diving Nutrition Workshop – 10/4/21 appeared first on Swim England North East.

item.title: Regional Swimming Championships (50m) 2021 – Update
item.dc:creator: Linda Tjaguns
item.description:
Swimmers and Parents/Carers will realise that it would not be possible to deliver the Regional Swimming Championships in April/May 2021 with the current social distancing rules are in place. The indications are that the current social distancing restrictions will not be relaxed by HM Government for some time. Although age group swimmers could be allowed […]

The post Regional Swimming Championships (50m) 2021 – Update appeared first on Swim England North East.
item.content:encoded:
Swimmers and Parents/Carers will realise that it would not be possible to deliver the Regional Swimming Championships in April/May 2021 with the current social distancing rules are in place.

The indications are that the current social distancing restrictions will not be relaxed by HM Government for some time.
Although age group swimmers could be allowed to return to the pool on 12th April (not confirmed until 5th April) senior swimmers will not be returning until after the Championships would have taken place.

Clearly most age group swimmers would not be fit enough to compete in a Regional Championships two weeks after returning to the pool.

The Swim England Swimming Leadership Group are working on plans to enable competitive swimming to return as soon as conditions allow. We will keep you updated on progress.

We hope that it may be possible to hold our Regional Championships (25m) in November 2021 as planned.
I realise that this will be a disappointment to many swimmers but the safety of our members must take priority over all other considerations.

Barry J Saunders, Swimming Manager, Swim England North East Region

The post Regional Swimming Championships (50m) 2021 – Update appeared first on Swim England North East.

item.title: Free Swim England Club Chair and Welfare Officer Workshops Spring 2021
item.dc:creator: Sarah Small
item.description:
Over the next few months, Swim England will be delivering a delivering a number of workshops and information sessions to Club Welfare Officers and Club Chairs. The Welfare Officer workshop is designed to give people in the role more support and understanding of expectations around their role. It does not replace the need for Time […]

The post Free Swim England Club Chair and Welfare Officer Workshops Spring 2021 appeared first on Swim England North East.
item.content:encoded:
Over the next few months, Swim England will be delivering a delivering a number of workshops and information sessions to Club Welfare Officers and Club Chairs.

The Welfare Officer workshop is designed to give people in the role more support and understanding of expectations around their role. It does not replace the need for Time to Listen or Safeguarding. This Chairs information session is specifically designed to cover dealing with internal club disputes, using the constitution and understanding the role the Chair plays in supporting the overall governance of the club. Each workshop or session is limited to 30 places and will be delivered online via Zoom.

Dates for both the Chair and Welfare Officers sessions can be found in the links below:

  • Club Chair: https://www.surveymonkey.co.uk/r/ClubChairSessions.
  • Club Welfare: https://www.surveymonkey.co.uk/r/Welfareofficerworkshops.

Please can you share this information with anyone who might be interested in attending.

The post Free Swim England Club Chair and Welfare Officer Workshops Spring 2021 appeared first on Swim England North East.

item.title: Swim England Covid-19 Guidance Forums
item.dc:creator: Sarah Small
item.description:

item.title: Swim England Foundation Coach Conference
item.dc:creator: David Parry
item.description:
Tickets are now on sale for the inaugural Swim England Foundation Coach Conference 2021. Open to coaches and teachers, the conference will feature the chance to quiz elite athletes who will share their club experiences, top tips for attracting and retaining new members and working with parents in sport. It takes place virtually on Sunday […]

The post Swim England Foundation Coach Conference appeared first on Swim England North East.
item.content:encoded:
Tickets are now on sale for the inaugural Swim England Foundation Coach Conference 2021.

Open to coaches and teachers, the conference will feature the chance to quiz elite athletes who will share their club experiences, top tips for attracting and retaining new members and working with parents in sport.

It takes place virtually on Sunday 25 April between 9.30am and 4.15pm and covers all aquatic disciplines.

Full details are available at: https://www.swimming.org/swimengland/foundation-coach-conference-2021/

The post Swim England Foundation Coach Conference appeared first on Swim England North East.

item.title: New Water Polo Referee Qualifications Structure
item.dc:creator: David Parry
item.description:
Swim England Water Polo Leadership Group has agreed a new qualification structure for water polo referees. The new qualifications are based on each referee’s level of competence at club, regional, national and international competitions. Full details are available at:https://www.swimming.org/waterpolo/referees-new-qualification-structure/

The post New Water Polo Referee Qualifications Structure appeared first on Swim England North East.
item.content:encoded:
Swim England Water Polo Leadership Group has agreed a new qualification structure for water polo referees.

The new qualifications are based on each referee’s level of competence at club, regional, national and international competitions.

Full details are available at:https://www.swimming.org/waterpolo/referees-new-qualification-structure/

item.title: Funding Opportunities for Clubs
item.dc:creator: David Parry
item.description:
Various potential funding opportunities are available for clubs to consider: Sport England – Return to Play: Small Grants (Capital Funding included) The Return to Play: Small Grants fund seeks to support projects addressing the challenges Covid-19 has posed to people taking part in sport and physical activity. Grants between £300 and £10,000 are available to […]

The post Funding Opportunities for Clubs appeared first on Swim England North East.
item.content:encoded:
Various potential funding opportunities are available for clubs to consider:

Sport England – Return to Play: Small Grants (Capital Funding included) The Return to Play: Small Grants fund seeks to support projects addressing the challenges Covid-19 has posed to people taking part in sport and physical activity. Grants between £300 and £10,000 are available to help sport and activity groups, clubs and organisations respond to the immediate challenges of returning to play in a coronavirus-safe way. This could include contributing to covering the costs incurred by having to deliver activity in smaller groups than normal, or having the correct hygiene and safety equipment. Applications are currently being accepted with notification of decisions within three weeks. Applications can be submitted at any time until 30 June 2021. https://www.sportengland.org/how-we-can-help/our-funds/return-play-small-grants

 

Sport England – Return to Play: Community Asset Fund (Capital Funding included) This fund will make awards of between £10,001 and £50,000 to help local sports clubs and organisations adapt and open important places and spaces to help their local community return to play safely. This could include contributing to covering the costs incurred by converting existing space to meet social distancing guidelines, or improving a facility’s ventilation. Applications are currently being accepted with notification of decisions within three weeks. https://www.sportengland.org/how-we-can-help/our-funds/return-play-community-asset-fund

 

Made by Sport – Thousands of grassroots sports organisations could each receive a grant of £2021 to help them recover from the Covid-19 pandemic after the Made By Sport charity received a donation of £4.79million from Flutter Entertainment. https://www.connectsport.co.uk/news/made-sport-distribute-grassroots-grants

 

Coalfields Recovery & Resilience Fund – The Coalfields Covid-19 Recovery & Resilience Fund is an interim replacement for the Coalfields Community Investment Programme (CCIP). Awards of up to £10,000 are available to address local needs in coalfield communities. Priority will be given to organisations that are delivering support services or have significantly adapted their services in order to respond to the current issues/challenges in their community and support vulnerable people. Please note the geographical restrictions. The guidance notes have been updated for 2021 and can be found on the Coalfields Regeneration Trust website. Key dates for the 2021 Committee meetings are:

April 2021 Committee – The Eligibility survey opens on 2 February 2021 and closes at 5pm on 12 March 2021. The deadline for applications is 26 March 2021 at 5pm.

July 2021 Committee – The Eligibility survey opens on 6 April 2021 and closes at 5pm on 4 June 2021. The deadline for applications is 18 June 2021 at 5pm.

October 2021 Committee – The Eligibility survey opens on 5 July 2021 and closes at 5pm on 10 September 2021. The deadline for applications is 24 September 2021 at 5pm.

https://www.coalfields-regen.org.uk/england/ccip-funding-support/

 

Yorkshire and Humber Funders are collaborating to support charities and communities respond to Covid 19. Against the backdrop of the already existing needs and challenges of the people and places in our region funders that have been supporting charities and communities across Yorkshire and Humber are trying to up their game in response to the significantly greater call on all of them because of Covid 19. All six Community Foundations in Yorkshire and Humber are part of the We Stand With The Sector Funders Response and through the Yorkshire Funder’s Forum the aim is to work with other funders to increase collaboration between local, regional and national funders during this crisis for Yorkshire and Humber. The six Community Foundations will also be the main distributing partners of the National Emergencies Trust (NET) Appeal. https://www.yorkshirefunders.org.uk/

 

The BlueSpark Foundation – awards grants between £2,000 to £5,000 that aim to improve the education and development of children and young people by means of educational, cultural, sporting or other activities. The funding is intended to support projects that have the following objectives: encouraging independence; developing team working skills; developing self-confidence; promoting creativity and individuality; encouraging aspiration; enhancing educational achievement; widening educational horizons The funding is for relatively small-scale projects, which might not happen at all or would only happen on a lesser scale without the support of BlueSpark. Apply anytime. http://bluesparkfoundation.org.uk/

 

Arnold Clark Community Fund – From 1st March 2021, the Arnold Clark Community Fund will be open to all UK registered charities and local community groups who need financial assistance due to the coronavirus pandemic. At the end of each month, 500 applications will be granted. Arnold Clark Community Fund

 

 

The post Funding Opportunities for Clubs appeared first on Swim England North East.
